intro: Suteria nuda, commonly known as the naked suteria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Suteria nuda is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in disturbed soils.
